process.name: Utility - Environment
process.narrative: Utilities for interacting with the environment - read screen resolution, determine OS type, etc.

subsheet.name: Start Process Read Stderr and Stdout

stage.name: Get Screen Resolution
stage.narrative: Gets the resolution of the screen in pixels for the current environment.

output.name: Horizontal Resolution
output.narrative: The number of pixels in the horizontal screen axis

output.name: Vertical Resolution
output.narrative: The number of pixels in the vertical screen axis

stage.name: new
stage.narrative:
Clean Up Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some finalisation (or "cleanup") tasks as your business object is closed down.
The cleanup action will be called automatically immediately after closing your business object at the end of a business process.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than before the disposal of the business object.

stage.name: new
stage.narrative:
Initialise Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some initialisation tasks after your business object is loaded.
The initialise action will be called automatically immediately after loading your business object.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than after the creation of the object.

stage.name: GetResolution
stage.code: dim S As Size = Screen.PrimaryScreen.Bounds.Size Horizontal_Resolution = S.Width Vertical_Resolution = S.Height

stage.name: Kill Process
stage.narrative: Force kills all processes with a given name.

condition.narrative: All processes with the given name will be terminated.

input.name: Process Name
input.narrative: The name of the process to kill

stage.name: Kill Process1
stage.code: Try for each p as System.Diagnostics.Process in System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessesByName(Process_Name) p.kill next Catch ex As Exception End Try

stage.name: Read Memory Stats
stage.narrative: Get memory statistics for a given set of processes including the working set and the virtual memory size.

input.name: Process Names
input.narrative: The names of the processes to get memory statistics for

output.name: Process Statistics
output.narrative: A collection of process statistics including the working set and the virtual memory size

stage.name: Get Stats
stage.code:
GC.Collect() Process_Statistics = New DataTable process_statistics.Columns.Add("Process Name", GetType(String)) process_statistics.Columns.Add("PID", GetType(Decimal)) process_statistics.Columns.Add("Working Set", GetType(Decimal)) process_statistics.Columns.Add("Virtual Memory", GetType(Decimal))
For Each R As DataRow in Processes.Rows dim ProcName As String = CStr(R("Process Name")) Dim PID As Integer = CInt(R("PID")) For Each P As Process in Process.GetProcesses() If P.ProcessName = ProcName OrElse P.ID = PID Then Process_Statistics.Rows.Add(New Object() {P.ProcessName, P.ID, P.WorkingSet64, P.VirtualMemorySize64}) End If Next Next

stage.name: Read Process Working Set
stage.narrative: Gets the size of the working set for the given process.

input.name: Process Name
input.narrative: The name of the process you want stats for

output.name: Working Set
output.narrative: The working set number holding memory stats for your process

stage.name: Get Memory Set
stage.narrative: Used += to return the total memory used by the application we are interested - just in case it is running multiple times.
stage.code: For Each P As Process in Process.GetProcesses() If P.ProcessName = Proc Then Working_Set += P.WorkingSet64 End If Next

stage.name: Font Smoothing Enabled
stage.narrative: Gets the font smoothing setting for the current environment.

output.name: Enabled
output.narrative: True if font smoothing is enabled

stage.name: Start Process
stage.narrative: Starts a process directly with the given arguments.

input.name: Application
input.narrative: The application or short cut to start

input.name: Arguments
input.narrative: Any arguments needed for the app

stage.name: Run Process Until Ended
stage.narrative: Run a process and wait until completion or timeout.

stage.name: Start Process
stage.code: If Arguments<>"" Then System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(Application, Arguments) Else System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(Application) End If

stage.name: Run Process
stage.code:
timedOut = False Dim startTime as Date = Date.Now
Dim info as New ProcessStartInfo(appn) If args <> "" Then info.Arguments = args If dir <> "" Then info.WorkingDirectory = dir
Using proc As Process = Process.Start(info) timedOut = Not proc.WaitForExit( _ CInt(timeout.TotalMilliseconds)) End Using

input.name: Application
input.narrative: The application or shortcut to start

input.name: Arguments
input.narrative: Optional - any arguments needed to run the application

input.name: Timeout
input.narrative: How long to wait for the application to finish. Default is 10 seconds

exception.detail: "Application " & [Application] & " was still running after the maximum time period"

stage.name: Wait for Process
stage.narrative: Attach to a process and wait for it to complete.

input.name: Maximum wait time (seconds)
input.narrative: The maximum time to wait for the process to complete

input.name: Process Name
input.narrative: The name of the process to attach to

stage.name: Wait for process
stage.code: Try Found_ = False Dim bProcFound as Boolean = False Dim iLoop as Integer = 0 Dim myProcesses() As System.Diagnostics.Process Dim instance As System.Diagnostics.Process Do While bProcFound = False AND iLoop < Max_Wait myProcesses = System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessesByName(Process_Name) For Each instance In myProcesses bProcFound = True Found_ = True Next Threading.Thread.Sleep(1000) iloop += 1 Loop Catch ex As Exception End Try

stage.name: Wait for Process Window
stage.narrative: Waits for a process with a given name has displayed a window with the given title.

input.name: Process Name
input.narrative: The name of the process to attach to

input.name: Window Title
input.narrative: The title of the window within the process

input.name: Wait
input.narrative: The maximum amount of time to wait for

stage.name: Find Process
stage.code:
try
for each p as system.diagnostics.process in system.diagnostics.process.getprocessesbyname(process_name)
if p.mainwindowtitle.trim.tolower like window_title.trim.tolower then found = true exit sub end if
next
catch e as exception end try

stage.name: Get Clipboard
stage.narrative: Gets the contents of the clipboard.

stage.name: Set Clipboard
stage.narrative: Sets the contents of the clipboard.

input.name: Clipboard
input.narrative: The value to set the clipboard to.

output.name: User Name
output.narrative: The name of the logged in user in the current system

output.name: Machine Name
output.narrative: The hostname of the machine running this action

stage.name: Start Process Read Stderr and Stdout
stage.narrative: Starts a process directly with the given arguments, reads the standard output and standard error and outputs them in seperate data items.

input.name: Arguments
input.narrative: The arguments that coincide with the process.

input.name: Process Name
input.narrative: The name of the process to start.

stage.name: Run Process read Output
stage.code:
Dim processName As String = Process_Name
Dim process As New Process() With { .StartInfo = New ProcessStartInfo() With { .FileName = processName, .Arguments = Argument, .UseShellExecute = False, .CreateNoWindow = True, .RedirectStandardError = True, .RedirectStandardOutput = True } }
process.Start()
' Read the standard out and standard error async ' to avoid any EOF blocking while the process ' waits to exit.
Dim standardOutput = process.StandardOutput.ReadToEndAsync() Dim standardError = process.StandardError.ReadToEndAsync()
process.WaitForExit()
If standardOutput.isCompleted Then Standard_Output = standardOutput.Result If standardError.isCompleted Then Standard_Error = standardError.Result
